website_summaries.verdict: This ash vacuum from one of the leaders in the field features a large 5-gallon capacity and powerful motor for extremely strong suction.
pros: Features a powerful 4.5 peak horsepower motor
Attractive design at a decent price
Works in both wet and dry conditions
Ships with a good collection of accessories
cons: Some reports that this option is difficult to assemble
The power cord is on the short side

website_summaries.verdict: A durable wet/dry vac for a value price from a reputable company. Especially suited for indoor use.
cons: Some owners have difficulty finding accessories to fit the 1.25-inch hose

customer_reviews.title: TRIUMPHANT EXPERIENCE! FIVE STARS!
customer_reviews.text: I am in awe of this voracious creature's ability to inhale. I brought it into my home, and it immediately began drawing a single, mighty breath. My other animals were startled and jealous of its ability. They barked loudly, trying to seem more important. To this day, it has yet to exhale, even a little. It gathers all manner of debris within its shiny belly. I pull off its head and pour its stomach contents into my waste bin on the regular, in an effort to show my other animals who is in charge, just so they all know. TRIUMPHANT EXPERIENCE! FIVE STARS!
customer_reviews.author: Charles A Winfield

customer_reviews.title: Sharp looking, not functional.
customer_reviews.text: With 3 dogs a shop vac is a must...this however is useful perhaps only for cars or small areas. Most annoying is that the cord is incredibly short, the tools neither stay together, nor do they have enough tension to stay on the "holders" on the actual vac for storage. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: meridethmomofmany

customer_reviews.title: Have Not Used It Yet... Box Infested With Spiders
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure it is a fine product but it came in it's original packaging and is loaded with HUGE spiders. One bit my dog on the face. I hit it with a shoe and it was so big, it splattered all over a floor and wall. I have to spray the box before I use this. Next time, try and inspect your product better.
customer_reviews.author: crassus747

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, and it feels like it.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how this thing has such positive reviews. The minute I took it out of the box I could feel how cheaply it's made. Worse yet, I thought I was going to break the latches that hold the top to the base the first time I took it apart for assembly, and there are stress lines in the plastic from just this initial opening(see picture). If I'm going to be using and emptying this regularly, it does not have my confidence in its longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M.

customer_reviews.title: cheap plastic garbage
customer_reviews.text: The core function--vacuuming--works fine on this unit. My issue is with the poor QC on all the attached plastics. The cord winder and attachment-storage pieces seem to have been designed for a different vacuum. They are meant to stretch between two spots and snap in to holes in the body of the vacuum, but they are too short, so they are always popping off. Kind of frustrating to deal with ill-conceived cord management solutions in 2018. I'm stuck with keeping the attachments in a drawer in my garage and sloppily cramming teh cord through the handle when the vac is not in use.
customer_reviews.author: djp

customer_reviews.title: Very nice shop Vac but...
customer_reviews.text: I really like this vacuum a lot. The first one I received had a motor issue when I turned it on. I put out a puff of smoke and then ran ok. When I turned it off it made a bad noise while slowing down. I returned it and received a replacement quickly. The second one runs and works great. I do like it a lot and would recommend it. The first one must have slipped by quality control for some reason. It is a very nice Shop Vac.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Jaeger

customer_reviews.title: Excellent smaller shop vacuum
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my old 12 gallon Shop Vac I'd had for 14 years. I'm older and my needs and abilities have changed. The swiveling casters are great. The more compact size and longer hose are excellent. The disposable vacuum cleaner bags are perfect! I'll likely buy a brush-head accessory, but the tools I used to clean the garage today were great. Note that the cord is 6' so you'll want a sturdy and flexible extension.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain West Bob

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy unless you want to be frustrated
customer_reviews.text: Inlet hose always fills up even though it items fits on the other end. Then you have to unplug the hose attach it to the suction side to clear out. Tried to use it in a bathroom demo and all I wanted to do was demolish the vacuum, literally every 30 seconds I had to stop and clear the hose. Suction doesn't seem what it is rated for, not very good for a car's carpet. The hose also comes out pretty easily when moving around. TL;DR Buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Steven L.

customer_reviews.title: Too small of a tank for water pick up.
customer_reviews.text: I used the vac for water pick up (with all of the filters off) from a slab leak. I let the vac run while I was looking for leak and turning the water off, the tank maxed out and float stopped the water pick up, it does this so that excess water doesn't get blown back out the vent pipe. The motor makes a higher pitched noise and I heard it and by the time I got back to the vac the motor was history. Only had the vac about 3 weeks and it was the third time I had used it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Paquette

customer_reviews.title: Huge disappointment
customer_reviews.text: The functionality of this product stinks. Yes, it is lightweight, suction is average and it was fairly easy to assemble. The clip to store the attachments is not in a functional place. The hose is extremely flimsy and I have no doubt that I overpaid for this hunk of junk. My biggest hang up on this is the cord length. The lack of usable length makes it near impossible to actually use. I now have to go out an buy an extension cord so I can actually use it or go through the trouble of returning it. Decisions decisions....
customer_reviews.author: jlisee2002

customer_reviews.title: Great little do-it-all shop vac
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a champ. It's rugged, very portable at its size, and holds all of the attachments nicely for an all-in-one unit. Great for general home use and auto detailing/vacuuming, of which is my normal use. Definitely wouldn't go this small for contractor or commercial use. I came from the older cloth dry filter style shop vac unit that always fell off. This one uses an actual filter element and now I don't start spewing dirt out of the blower end once that rag falls off the wet filter element. This thing is GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Topher Mecier

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I really liked how the shop vac had wheels and how it's metal. Bought for my husband for Christmas and it's been really nice having around these last few months. One thing's I didn't really like which is not a deal breaker is how you attach and store the accessories. Mine keeps coming off the actual clip that holds it onto the vac. For the price and size of this product I would definitely say it is well worth it. If your looking for a small shop vac this is the one. I looked at so many and really this price is such a great buy. You won't be disappointed, I can assure you that.
customer_reviews.author: Momof3

customer_reviews.title: Good Vac - Came damaged.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vac for cleaning out our vehicles and light garage use. It will definitely do those jobs without a problem. It’s a very nice looking vac and comes equipped with all the attachments that are needed. I was disappointed that the vac came with a softball sized dent on the side. That’s the problem with stainless steel vs heavy plastic. I didn’t bother to go through the hassle of returning it. There are similar vacs through Amazon and Home Improvement Stores with a better price. Still, it’s a good shop vac and I’m not sorry that I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: LER North Carolina

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy Construction
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculous instructions, very cheap construction, very short cord, does not live up to the Shop Vac name. I can''t believe it got 41/2 stars out of five. However, do what I didn't do...don't just look at the rating, read the first three comments and they will tell you the whole story. My husband and I didn't even get as far as noise level, suction power, and maneuverability. Just looking at the flashy, pretty machine that had terrible instructions, the cord, and the quality of material had us putting it back in the box before we ever turned it on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love at first, but vacuum has already malfunctioned.
customer_reviews.text: We loved how handy this vacuum is. It was a Christmas present for my wife (She asked for it). Unfortunately, the vacuum has already malfunctioned. I plugged it in about a week ago, flipped the switch, but to my dismay the vacuum did not respond. I flipped it on and off, but nothing happened. I changed outlets and tried again, nothing. I changed the extension cord, but nothing again. My vacuum that is only 5 months old is already dead in the water. It was great while it lasted, but I feel we just threw our money away with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Utterback

customer_reviews.title: Needs bags, doesn't produce strong vacuum but does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Negative : the tools are not convenient to assemble and store on the device. The instruction sheet, shows drawings from an other version with other accessories. The vacuum created is not particularly strong, and not sufficient to produce a strong suction when using the largest tool. Needs vaccuum cleaner bags, unlike other wet/dry models. Positive : light device relative to it's size. long hose and stable base, not easily tipped off. The blower function comes handy for outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: F.corlierTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Little Shop Vac!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to keep my garage tidy. This is a NICE little shop vac! It has every tool imaginable. Its a vacuum and it is also easily converted to a blower. There are 3 longer attachments that can be stacked, one on top of another, so I could even vacuum cobwebs off of the ceiling w/out needing a step stool!!! Set up was easy as was setting up the dust collection filter and bag. The wheels just pop and lock in and they roll great. When you are finished cleaning this little vac holds all of its own equipment. I couldn't be happier with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jen P

customer_reviews.title: Loses suction easily
customer_reviews.text: My previous Shop Vac lasted 15 years of solid use. This one gave out after one week. Changed filters several times, kept hose clear, but soon enough the vac stopped sucking even though the engine continued to run and the noise didn't change. Yes, I took the hose out and tested at the opening...nothing but noise. Finally got it working acceptably again when after I cleaned the lip of the canister before reattaching the lid/motor. Still doesn't suck like my old one, but it is functional.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Hummer

customer_reviews.title: Good vacuum so far, good suction
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace my old, over 15 year old 5 gal Shop Vac when I ran over it after vacuuming my car. I've only had this new one for a week and used this a few times but so far this new one is a great little shop vac. Lots of suction. Rolls easily. Hose is nice and long. Lid clamps on very tightly and doesn't come off when you pick it up by the top handle (a problem with my old model). My only negative is that this one is a bit heavier in weight than my old one. Perhaps it is due to the metal canister - my old one was all plastic.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for few times now. Few problem about this product. Easy to stocked the hole. Every time I open it. Have to be very carefully. The handle is very weak and easy to broken. The bag inside the machine is not good. Maybe I install it wrong way. It’s average product. You got what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Qing H. Chen

customer_reviews.title: Cheap metal rusted through in a month
customer_reviews.text: Be weary of the "Stainless steel" name with this Vacuum. The steel base of the vacuum rusted right through within a month of use. To be clear, I live by the ocean, so I know things rust much faster with salty air, but for this to have rusted through the bottom of the container in a month is non sense. Its made of very cheap metal, not recommended as a wet vac for this reason.
customer_reviews.author: Mardagan

customer_reviews.title: When sucking is good!
customer_reviews.text: My new vacuum arrived on the day expected. Easy to assemble using the clearly printed instructions. This "little jewel" has a huge motor, thus lots of sucking power. Comes with plenty of attachments to get almost anything clean. I have an older, larger model. It's tool carrier is far superior to the new vacuum tool carrier. It's flimsy, doesn't want to hold tools much. You will be better off only putting what you have to use in it and storing the other pieces on a shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Jaeckels

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and at first I thought I'd been ripped off, but then I realized all of the tools and manual, etc were inside the canister! It was so easy to put together and I am extremely happy with this purchase! I am restoring my home on 3 floors after hurricane Florence and Micheal hit and this was a great purchase in helping with the reconstruction!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: The plug cord is too short!
customer_reviews.text: This is quite a powerful little gizmo, easy to handle because of its small size. The suction tube is a small diameter, so it's not going to work for bigger pickups, say, leaves in the carport. It's good for stray pieces of cat litter, though. The plug cord is about 3-4 feet, so you'll have to unplug it and replug it somewhere else in practically any room, even a small room.
customer_reviews.author: Marion the Librarian

customer_reviews.title: Works Soooo Gooooood
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clean up MASSIVE amounts of concrete dust , concrete pieces and rocks and also HUGE amounts of sawdust from my log home construction with a basement full of crumbly concrete (my husband and I tried to do it ourselves and it was a disaster) . I use it daily and it has never stopped sucking it all up . I also accidently dropped it down a flight of log steps and it got a big dent in it and it just keeps sucking away like its brand new . Awesome little Shop-Vac , highly recommend !!
customer_reviews.author: shelley raymond

customer_reviews.title: It sucks.
customer_reviews.text: Build quality is great but to call this thing a shop vac is damn near false advertising. It clogs EVERY time I vacuum. I have a dog so I figured I'd buy this guy as I've had fantastic results vacuuming up dog hair with borrowed shop vacs in the past but I can't get on board with this thing. The hose is way too narrow and the suction power is sub par.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Damaged but Decent
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to replace my old smaller shop vac. When it arrived the box had no visible signs of damage on it, but when I took it out of the box, there was a big dent in the side of it. I thought about returning it, but figured it really didnt matter, it didnt affect the usefulness of it. This works as well as any other shop vac nothing more or less. Just be sure to check your box when you get it, and be sure to send it back if you cant live with a dent.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Conway

customer_reviews.title: Poor setup instructions, but good vacuum overall
customer_reviews.text: Setup instructions were extremely poor. The instructions were not even model specific and combined several models. A bit rediculous as the vacuum isn’t difficult to put together but the instructions made it more difficult. Vacuum overall though is good quality, helped to clean a large mess which I didn’t want to use my regular vacuum. It has good suction, but is pretty small so keep that in mind before purchasing. Overall would recommend and I’m satisfied with the purchase and quality of item.
customer_reviews.author: MF

customer_reviews.title: Small size BUT powerful !
customer_reviews.text: Small and cute design but very powerful! Its smaller than my last one but works better. Its not cheap quality like some mentioned here and its easy to assembly (its only the wheels on the bottom) not sure why some said its difficult ! Totally recommend. I love that its not bulky and i can bring it anywhere -if you like my review feel free to click the “helpful” button
customer_reviews.author: Aless

customer_reviews.title: Great for the job
customer_reviews.text: Did it's job - a nasty crawlspace/rodent cleanup that I'd rather not have done. Be aware that the cord is very short and the volume of the shop vac is very small - most of it is occupied by the hepa filter, and if you use the bag it comes with, that'll be completely full quickly. I was extremely happy with it, as it allowed me to do a one-off and not feel too bad about discarding it later. I had to unclog the intakes multiple times, which I expected and is not a design defect but simply a matter of course for a small shop vac. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Traveller

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shop vac!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace two other shop vacs I had: a large old one and a newer small one. The large one was bulky and had a 2" hose and tools, and the small one was easy to move around but just didn't work very well. Like the story about Goldilocks, this one is just right! It's 1.25" hose and tools match my built-in vac (so the tools are interchangeable) and the power is twice that of the older, larger vac.
customer_reviews.author: Aloha Bill 77

customer_reviews.title: Hard to install wheels.
customer_reviews.text: Can’t tell if I like it or not. Have it almost put together but can’t get one wheel in it’s hole.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Lover

customer_reviews.title: Won’t work to get dog hair out of carpets
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t suck up dog hair from carpets, I bought it because the car washes near me have pretty weak vacuums (because they’re broken in some way) but this did not do the trick. Just not enough power and the attachments aren’t great. This is good for people that want to suck up dust, from their work areas, not so much vacuum. Good for floors. It is indeed lightweight but the hose is kinda short.
customer_reviews.author: Yook

customer_reviews.title: Designed to FAIL
customer_reviews.text: Beyond terrible. Designed to FAIL. A complete waste of money and time. The thin plastic on the release levers almost broke on THE FIRST USE! Notice the white stress area on the black plastic in photo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size Shop vac!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this small shop vac! Size is perfect. Bought it for cleaning my sink and AC drains as well as vacuuming my car. This baby has great suction. Agree with other review regarding the exhaust hindering the attachment holder. Dumb. Design needs rework but isn't a deal breaker. I just leave one attachment on hose.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Bad, just bad.  Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: It was confusing to assemble, was immediately clogged and barely had any suction power, but other than that... Shop Vac was always the gold standard in my mind, this was very disappointing, just a bad piece of equipment that barely worked. the hose couldn't handle very small wood chips without immediately clogging.
customer_reviews.author: A A

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this shop vac for use with rental property. Had the opportunity to use it to remove water from soaked carpet and pad and it worked great so glad I had this available. Using this I was able to save the new padding and carpet plus cost of calling a expensive extraction service. This machine did great in extracting the water and I was able to use fans to dry flooring in 24 hours. I went to one of the big box home supply store and purchased mildew retardant spray to apply and reinstall flooring as before.
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: Not a good unit
customer_reviews.text: The cord and hose is a giant cluster to get wrapped up and for purchasing a small unit that I could wrap up quickly/cleanly this didn’t fit the bill. The cord wrap price keeps falling off the vacuum and for something that I use everyday makes me want to throw the whole thing in the garbage. Never expected this poor of quality for shop vac as this is the third I have owned. Stupid me threw the box away so now I’m stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Cord length is only six foot!
customer_reviews.text: Cord length is only six foot! So you have to buy an extension cord and find said extension cord every time you want to use it. and worse, they don't bother to tell you that on Amazon in the description - you can find it out only if you search the questions/answers.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Parizek

customer_reviews.title: Price is right!
customer_reviews.text: Hoses/tubes too small for old vac's attachments but I just put a piece of tape on the end of one tube to make a good snug fit. They fit their own attachments fine and are quite adequate---I just didin't want to throw out my old Miele attachments-- The unit is thin metal so very, very light. I love this little thing---it has GREAT suction for such a small unit.......definitely for the home guy/user in a small shop/garage....I would get a much bigger one for the Construction boyz (like I used to be).........very happy.
customer_reviews.author: JMD

customer_reviews.title: Cheap not like what they use to be
customer_reviews.text: Cheap not like what they use to be, I was going to use it for the house as I'm tired of buying expensive vacuums do to my animals, the plastic is super thin and cheap, what ever your vacuuming up it grinds everything into your flooring, foam sleeve ripped in half as I was carefully trying to put it on, tool holder does not hold tools and cord is way to short. Hello garage.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Reliable quality
customer_reviews.text: This thing always works for me and gets the job done! When I was a dog groomer we used this to suck up hair from haircuts. We did baths in the same room so some of it would be wet. This thing always worked for us. I think a grooming salon is the ultimate test for a vacuum! I just bought one for my house because I had such a good experience with it at my old workplace. It's a quality product that hasn't let me down yet!
customer_reviews.author: Sara O.

customer_reviews.title: Great Medium Sized Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace an old Craftsman shop vacuum. This unit is compact and certainly provides sufficient suction. It is a bit louder than I expected it to be. And, the accessory holder is a bit strange. It has places on it to hold items but is blocked by the exhaust nozzle.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Damaged when recieved
customer_reviews.text: This only gets 3 stars from me because it was damaged when I received it. Luckily my husband was able to fix it where we could use it. The box had a big hole torn I. It and the barrel was bent. The top of the shop vac is cracked and we taped it. I was desperate to use it and needed it so I did not return it. Normally I would have. It does work and works good now that it is fixed. But hate to fix something you just bought.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the shine distract you, look for a different model.
customer_reviews.text: This is a super cute shopvac, that's mostly why I bought this one. BUT, the hoses are so narrow and narrow even further at the attachment points. A dryer sheet clogs the hose. The only thing it's good for is sucking up saw dust and dog hair. Unless you have a German Shepard during shedding season, it will clog. The filter takes up nearly the entire drum. It's a very smal vac, especially for the price. Also, it has the shortest cord. Had to get my extension cord out because I didn't want to keep plugging and unplugging. Then I just quit because it kept clogging.
customer_reviews.author: Wifey

customer_reviews.title: Installation is not that easy
customer_reviews.text: I like it is on wheels. As a 60+ year old woman I do not like instructions that expect you to be able to exert pressure on the wheels while twisting to snap them into place. I found it much easier to tap them on with a small hammer and a screwdriver without the detachable screw in place on the top of it. There is a risk of damaging it but I was careful. I think Shop Vacs could attach the wheels onto each unit. They use multiple items on their shop vacs that can be used on multiple vacuums. It made the directions difficult to follow but I got the job done. Works well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Thomas

customer_reviews.title: My new best friend!! Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Is it wrong to love a vacuum? I love this little guy! He is light weight and does an excellent job at assisting me in cleaning my house. I have a lot of pet fur and this guy get's it right off my hard wood floors like magic. He also is able to suck it up off some of my soft chairs. The cord was a little small to get all the way across some of my larger living spaces but with an extension cord there's no end to where this guy can go!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: this is better than the one I'm replacing it with
customer_reviews.text: my garbage disposal kept backing up into the dishwasher (which we really don't use) and there would be this disgusting smell. Thank you to the makers of this wet vac machine! I was able to suck out all of the putrid scuzzy water from the dishwasher and dump it in the lower level commode in one easy shot. so far that's all I've used it for but I think that it'll be great for all of our other messes too.
customer_reviews.author: HCBG

customer_reviews.title: Smaller hose diameter means it gets blocked very often
customer_reviews.text: This shop vac has decent suction power and we thought the size was perfect with respect to mobility and ease of handling. The biggest problem was hose diameter, the narrow hose diameter means it cannot really be used as a "shop" vac, I had pieces of wood/scrap get stuck into the hose every 30 secs and I had to stop to clean it up. I ended up replacing this vac with a competitor brand with wide hose diameter.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Mo

customer_reviews.title: wheel issue.
customer_reviews.text: did not like the manual. it was very small print and difficult to read. most of it made no sense as there were several models that they referred to. include the manual that applies to the model ordered please. wheels did not fit. have to call shop vac on Monday morning to report this issue then return it and start all over again. very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are completely useless
customer_reviews.text: Every single line in the instruction manual is tagged "warning: does not apply to all models". There is no indication of whether or not a particular section *does* apply to your model, which means there's no way of knowing if you're about to use your shop vac correctly, or if you're about to destroy it. And good luck Googling for help. "Shop Vac brand shop vacs?" God.
customer_reviews.author: thomas.galvin

customer_reviews.title: Powerful suction, variety of attachments!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Shop Vac and I love it. It was easy to assemble, has enough attachments, suction power is very strong. I have used it in the garage and in the house to vacuum rugs and furniture because the suction is so powerful. I would recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Sally Sumrall

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. It’s an adequate little wet dry vacuum for a reasonable price. The instructions for converting from dry to wet is confusing. The body is flimsy sheet metal and the plastic parts were poorly designed and don’t fit well. I’ll enjoy it for a few years for the occasional basement flood and then chuck it. For $60 bucks no harm no foul. If you’re looking for a real workhorse shop vac, spend more and look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Small Vacuum, Good Features
customer_reviews.text: It's a small shop vac that I purchased to replace my antique mid-80's number that finally died on me. The only complaint I have is that the "tool holder" doesn't actually do much holding, especially if you want to coil up the power cord. Otherwise, a great little machine that cleans up like mad.
customer_reviews.author: Elvis Impersonator

customer_reviews.title: Fast Shipment as expected
customer_reviews.text: It is a shop vac so it does exactly what it needs to do. All attachments were included. It works great and has strong suction power that you would expect from a shop vac. The only thing I wish is that they made the power cord a longer length.
customer_reviews.author: Babsi

customer_reviews.title: Clogs, poorly made
customer_reviews.text: The small hose makes it clog super quick, it feels to be made cheay, the holders for accessories are poorly made. Go get the rigid shop vac for cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: DeeWall

customer_reviews.title: Shop-Vac 5989300 5-Gallon 4.5 Peak HP Stainless Steel Wet Dry Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this vacuum to replace a much larger version, found that the power head which connects to the vacuum tank does not have the old quality of what it replaced, the stainless steel tank is on the thin side. However when head and tank are connected correctly, this vac has plenty of suction power and adequet for what it was purchase for a smaller easier to handle we/dry vacuum cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Pauln CT

customer_reviews.title: Good vac
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than i anticipated because i did not pay attention to gal capacity. However, as it turns out i don't currrntly need a bigger vac. NOT FOR INDUSTRIAL USE Cute size. Works well, not complicated Some assembly req'd. Minimal attachments Short wire, needs an extension cord for ALL APPLICATIONS. Otherwise, i like it. Glad to have bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: This shop vac works pretty well. In retrospect, I probably should have purchased a bit bigger shop vac, or at least one with a bigger hose. I am constantly unclogging the hose in order for the vac to work properly. I will keep it and continue using, but should have shopped around a bit more first.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow...you can't go wrong with this...
customer_reviews.text: Using it and scrapers to take down popcorn ceilings...messy job easily done with this and you tube video...
customer_reviews.author: Christine K.

customer_reviews.title: I love this vac
customer_reviews.text: I love this vac!! It does a great job, better than my previous one, because it has more power. Great accessories, more than what you would normally get from some stores that sell it. Plenty of powerful suction!! I would only change 1 thing, if it had a way to turn down the suction for lighter rugs. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality lasts long works strong
customer_reviews.text: I use it to clean all the fur from my husky Which is a lot of work every day so far I’ve had it for a year or so and still working great ya don’t even need to use a bag just gets in the way
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: SHOP VAC STILL A GOOD VALUE.
customer_reviews.text: WHEELS WERE EASY TO ATTACH. HOWEVER THE 2 HANDLES HAD THE WRONG SIZE SCEWS AND LACKED ENOUGH PARTS TO ATTACH TO SHOP VAC. DISAPPOINTED. MUST CTC COMPANY FOR RIGHT SCREWS SO THAT I CAN EASILY PICK IT UP. OTHER THAN THAT, SUCTION GREAT AND VERY LIGHT TO WORK WITH.
customer_reviews.author: Maura

customer_reviews.title: Love this little shop vac to get all the nooks ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this little shop vac to get all the nooks and crannies of stuff from corners, and pick up lots of our dog hairs. Suction nozzle is rather small, and the extension cord is very short which is why I gave it 4 stars. You will definitely need to purchase a long extension cord in order to really use this machine. That part of the design wasn't done well.
customer_reviews.author: Erin K Morse

customer_reviews.title: Not worth price.
customer_reviews.text: Poor design. No rubber seal ring... hard to clean and bag is smashed inside with no room to expand when filled with debris. going to return. For the price should be way better.
customer_reviews.author: B. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Shop-Vac is Still the Go-To for Workshop Cleaning Needs
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in a timely manner and works as expected. Not sure if there was an update to newer models, but the strength of the suction seems to be lower than older models as I remember. Even with the lower suction level than I anticipated it is still a great tool that I recommend every household have as it is more versatile than your average vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this shopvac so much that I purchased a new ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this shopvac so much that I purchased a new one after my ex stole my previous one! This little sucker wheels around fantastically and has awesome suction power. The cord is a bit short, so I do use an extension cord. I think it is safe to say I love this thing more than my carpet vacuum and use it frequently to clean stairs and dust from the corners of my wood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Enzo

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as I expected
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this machine does the job. I bought this to keep in my garage to clean my car. I have not used it on anything wet. But dry, it has great suction and cleans well.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Exceptionally powerful!
customer_reviews.text: Whether cleaning up around my parrots, the shop ..., it's more than capable. Great size as well. True, they didn't splurge on the power cord; however, they made up for it with a long hose. The cord's a non-issue, as I have always has an extension cord on all vacs. Good sized filter; easy to clean - buy a spare for rotation. Love the stainless canister as well. The "tool rack" is pretty much a joke, but a minor inconvenience given the pros.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey G.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't really do the job as promised
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product, after all the good reviews. I got it to vacuum my basement. It has a blower and a vacuum, but the vacuum constantly fills up with debris, and it's not clear on the product which switch is for what. It's very barebones, which would be fine if it worked, but it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: I should have done more research.
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum isn't powerful enough for my needs. I should have done more research before buying. The hose gets plugged up very quickly when trying to pick up small leaves in the back yard. I will need to go buy a bigger unit with more power. This might be fine if all that you are doing is getting the corners from inside your house, but not enough for yard work.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: this is a nice little shop vac
customer_reviews.text: this is a nice little shop vac, seems to work good and looks nice. two points of aggro are the placement of the attachments, those will be lost in no time, and the little foam sleeve which doesnt stay in place on the filter and after a few times putting it back on i ripped it, not a big deal but enough to keep 5 stars at bay!!
customer_reviews.author: Rita Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Latch release
customer_reviews.text: The latch is poorly designed. I used a small knife to gently pry open the latch. If you force it with your hands only it looks like it will break off. The photo shows the direction it opens. It is amazing a product gets designed given the latch is one of the main functions of the item. Just open it gently with a small screw driver or knife. It opens away from the main vac.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe on East Coast

customer_reviews.title: Just isn't as powerful as the ones of yesteryear
customer_reviews.text: It sometimes sucks at sucking...I had an old 5-gal years ago that would pick up ANYTHING. This one feel a bit weak by comparison. They just don't make them like they used to!
customer_reviews.author: Michael R

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: I cannot attest to the noise level, maneuverability, or suction because this was a gift. The couple has told me that they are enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey Rose

customer_reviews.title: It’s super easy to put together and a nice compact size
customer_reviews.text: I decided to purchase this Shop-Vac instead of just renting one from Home Depot or Lowe’s. It’s super easy to put together and a nice compact size. It works like a charm and I have nothing bad to say about it. The only thing is that I wish the cord was longer. I just went out and bought an extension cord so problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Strong little machine.
customer_reviews.text: I read previous reviews of this and wondered. Once I got it and started using it - this is a great little vacuum. Strong, multiple filters and attachments, well worth the money. As stated in previous reviews, where you wrap the cord/store the attachments is poorly placed. All else well was thought out and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Works well, needs a longer cord
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly. Had some difficulties getting the wheels to snap into place. Wish the cord was longer as I live in an old house with sorrowfully few outlets. Works well for dry pick up. Have not needed to use wet cleanup yet. Blower will be very helpful this fall.
customer_reviews.author: Shana

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves it
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my carpenter husband and he's been using it at work everyday. He's very happy with it so far, and he's probably owned more than 6 shop vacs in his time.
customer_reviews.author: Roxy

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing power in this shop vac... Is well worth the money... Not only does it look so sharp on the outside it is even better by how well it vacuums up things which is money well spent for sure!! I highly recommend this shop vac as you won't be disappointed I'm positive :)
customer_reviews.author: C. Billick

customer_reviews.title: Small but powerful
customer_reviews.text: I've had several shop vacs over the years and this one is the best bang for the buck. I rigged a quick connect to my miter saw and my table saw. It works great and then grab the hose and do any other clean up with little or no effort. Cool Beans!!! Money well spent!
customer_reviews.author: Don B

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Use often and still works just as well, as when I bought 2 years ago. Use mostly to empty water tank for water monitor, and no rust.
customer_reviews.author: Groovytune

customer_reviews.title: eh ... I got what I paid for
customer_reviews.text: It works but some of the more annoying aspects affect usage. The tool rack that "clicks in" comes off repeatedly. The 10 foot cord is way too short, extension cord is needed every time I use it. The hose will pop off the vac, its not secured in the place.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Zuba

customer_reviews.title: I thought it was too heavy and bulky for a smaller shop vac
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was too heavy and bulky for a smaller shop vac. My old one weighs much less and has a couple more gallon capacity. I returned and bought a lighter weight vac.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS VAC
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS VAC. I HAD IT BEFORE, AND I HAVE A SIBERIAN HUSKY AND BY THIS TIME OF THE YEAR THE HAIR IN MY HOUSE IS SO OVERWHELMING, BUT I LOVE MY BABY SO I HAD TO PURCHASE THIS VAC AGAIN. IT WORKS GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.author: yanira e valdez

customer_reviews.title: Keep your old Shop Vac for parts swap.
customer_reviews.text: The new Vac has a very short electric cord. I changed mine out with the original from my 15 year old unit. It is much longer and more flexible than the new one. The cord wrap holder is useless so just get rid of it and wrap the cord around the body of the unit instead. The attachments are a joke so keep your old ones and they fit fine on the new hose. The motor seems to be solid, the wheels turn and the suction is strong.
customer_reviews.author: MRMARKETZ

customer_reviews.title: Great if you get the Deluxe accessories pack with 2.5 inch hosing and accessories
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum would be great and would have received 5 stars if it came with 2.5" gauge housing and accessories, which it can totally accommodate. Instead, I had to spend another $80 on new accessories and hosing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W.

customer_reviews.title: On a positive note, this vacuum sucks!
customer_reviews.text: It's nice that it's little and maneuverable. However, the tool storage is not intuitive and the power cord is very short. In addition, the internal filter is very delicate. I'm used to banging the filter from my old shop vacuum (not a Shop-Vac brand) to clean it. When I did that with this one, the filter deformed badly.
customer_reviews.author: C. Slovacek

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality hardware - Thin Plastic Latches
customer_reviews.text: The shop vac itself is very nice, but I immediately noticed that the plastic where the red latches lock down have stress cracks. Every time you remove the motor from the metal housing the stress cracks get bigger. Needless to say I was disappointed, so we’ll see how long this lasts
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little vac
customer_reviews.text: Its a little small. It works amazing.cleaned out our cars like a champ. Great suction. I would recommend it if you dont have alot of storage space or dont want a big one.we really like ours. Money well spent for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is extremely loud, and it burnt out and died in a smoldering heap after 3 weeks of use. Bought a Stanley instead.
customer_reviews.author: Pdimens

customer_reviews.title: I'm going to attach it the best I can and hope it works
customer_reviews.text: Came in parts and had to be assembled. The instructions are not accurate. Particularly attaching the bag, the diagram doesn't match the actual vacuum whatsoever. I'm going to attach it the best I can and hope it works, but there's not gasket it mechanism to hold the bag in place. This is generally cheaply made, lots of plastic, and the assembly instructions are worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki V

customer_reviews.title: Small Messes
customer_reviews.text: I got this for small area of basement floors, it's suction works perfect for dust and cobwebs and what ever is messy
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: It sucks because it doesn’t suck.
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is absolute crap, unfortunately I wasn’t able to try it out within the return period and now I’m not sure how to contact the seller. It doesn’t work, I bought it to get pine needles out of my boat and it doesn’t pick them or anything else up.
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: What suction?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clean out my car and do general upkeep in the garage. I hate it. It can barely suck up little gravel rocks that are on the floor or my car, I have to lift the hose to get an debri heavier then a pebble to go into the bag. It was such a waste. I’m mad at my self for not testing it before the return window was up.
customer_reviews.author: JessicaEW

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly described
customer_reviews.text: This shop-vac is exactly as I expected based on the description.
customer_reviews.author: cviola

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality motor
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum worked great for about 10 minutes then started slowing down and the motor started smelling like it was going to catch fire. Cheap foreign craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Great product for pet owners
customer_reviews.text: I got this dry vac because I have 2 small dogs that shed a lot in the Spring. It's a perfect product for pet owners who need to clean after pets. It works well on floors, probably wouldn't work for carpet. It's small and powerful. It comes with lots of different accesories.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Azahar

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: Sucks. Broke within a few weeks. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: kitty

customer_reviews.title: Great capacity
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this vacuum for basement and garage cleanup. The suction power was what we expected and the capacity exceeded our expectations! I would recommend this product to my friends!
customer_reviews.author: wilhelm

product_meta.title: Shop-Vac 5989300 5-Gallon 4.5 Peak HP Stainless Steel Wet Dry Vacuum
product_meta.description: The Shop-Vac 5 Gallon 4.5 Peak HP Stainless Steel Wet / Dry Vacuum features a durable, easy to clean, stainless steel tank. This vacuum provides you with powerful cleaning for picking up wet or dry messes in your garage, workshop or basement. Attach the hose to the rear blower port to blow dirt out of those hard to reach places or grass clippings from your sidewalk.
feature_bullets: POWERFUL & PORTABLE: This wet/dry vacuum has a 5-gallon stainless steel tank & a 4.5 peak horsepower motor. Maneuverable full circumference dolly, & top & side carry handles enhance its portability.

ACCESSORIES INCLUDED: This wet/dry vac includes 1.25 " diameter accessories: 7-foot hose, 3 extension wands, crevice tool, gulper nozzle, floor nozzle, plus cartridge filter, foam sleeve & filter bag.
GOT DIRT? Shop-Vac's full line of products includes cordless, rechargeable wet dry vacuums, automotive vacuum systems, air movers, attachments & more. Whatever the job, Shop-Vac has you covered!
AN AMERICAN ORIGINAL: Shop-Vac offers the most complete line of vacuum cleaners, bags, filters, attachments, kits, & other cleaning tools available for home, industrial, & commercial applications.

TOUGH & DEPENDABLE: Shop-Vac Corporation is the recognized world leader in wet/dry vacuum cleaners. Since 1965, we have made innovative, high quality vacuum cleaners, filters, bags, & other accessories.

specifications.Included Components: Vac, hose, wands, nozzles, filters, manual
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,535 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
